posts.content:
Hail, ECBers

This build isn't exactly mine, it's Grimnir's Tiny Reaper build with a few alterations to make it Tomi-style. In fact, the first time I saw that build back in the old guild, I thought to myself: It's Tomi! In the OC, Tomi is a very selfish and manipulating, but also very smart Halfling who kept doing whatever he could to get ahead. He had no problem doublecrossing anyone if it meant profit for him, like when he gave out his friend to steal the Rubi of Calimshan. Anyway, to me he was always evil, and not only that, but the worst kind of evil, deceptive evil, one that pretends to be your friend until it suits him to stab you in the back and then he does so with no remorse. So, with that in mind, I made him an Assassin, because he always felt more like someone who would turn down a fight with you, then sneak into your room in the middle of the night and cut your throat. I hope, Grim, that you allow me this poetic exception of posting a build so similar to yours, but themed to a henchman. He can use all traps, open most if not all locks, use stealth, and has a pretty decent AB overall. He will also make use of all magic items he encounters, and even some he will buy on his own through some of his underground connections.

Anyway, here is the little selfish bastard: Tomi Undergallows!
